data.title: London 2012 Olympics Schedule: Complete Week 1 Info
data.meta_description: With Week 1 of the 2012 Summer  Olympics  from London, England kicking off July 28, the excitement over the Games has people all around the world ready for all the action...
data.text:
Top Sport of the Day: Archery

While many causal fans don’t know much about archery, it’s one of the oldest sports in the world. Like most Olympic games started, archery was used for hunting, and the hunters would compete with each other to test their skills.

Now, we have some of the most technologically advanced bows and arrows you could imagine. That’s what thousands of years of innovation will get you.

Top Sport of the Day: Equestrian

While many fans may not consider riding a horse to be a sport, it will only take a few minutes of watching the equestrian action before understanding just how difficult these athletes and horses must train.

If the casual fan is looking to give a sport a chance that they could try at a place rather close to them, there are horse farms across the nation. What better ways to get a child into loving animals than by letting them emulate those competing.

Top Sport of the Day: Volleyball

There are a few fans that look at the volleyball competition as a place to be creepy; there is some serious competition on the sand of London. This is the action fans should take lightly because of the competitors’ outfits.

The United States always has a great showing in this event, so keep an eye on the normally great women and the underdog men. Both units are looking for gold.

Top Sport of the Day: Table Tennis

Right off the bat, let me say that this is not the sport you remember from high school gym class. These competitors get serious about their table tennis.

Don’t call it ping pong.

If fans are looking to watch something enjoyable and can get over the fact that you have the same table in your garage, there is no better action than two of the most intense people attacking a table tennis event.

Top Sport of the Day: Badminton

While tennis may be the more normally accepted version of this game, I much prefer my volley game with a shuttlecock—badminton over tennis every single time.

As much as people want to complain and say that this looks like a game you bought from the local store and set up in your yard, watch a few minutes of this intense action and you won’t feel so confident in your badminton abilities.

Top Sport of the Day: Swimming

One of the sports that everyone loves is swimming. But while the races are amazing, one of the most underrated sports in the entire Olympics this year is synchronized swimming.

As someone who can’t do anything in the same time twice, imagining swimming in perfect harmony is not something I can comprehend. The skill and training needed to do this sport is awe-inspiring.
